main_definition: Summer is the warmest season of the year, occurring between spring and autumn, typically from late June to September in the Northern Hemisphere.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A period or time during the months with high temperatures
meanings_and_examples.example: The summer vacation is a great time for families to travel.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression meaning 'a long, hot period', often used in sports contexts
meanings_and_examples.example: After that one-hour marathon match under the scorching sun, we were all bone tired from running through the summer.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The seasonal segment of a business's year dedicated to certain activities or products
meanings_and_examples.example: Our company has its special summer sale every June and July.
